author: cnbc.com
title: JND eDiscovery Appoints David Hanika as Regional Vice President
text:
SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- JND eDiscovery, a division of JND Legal Administration, has appointed David Hanika as regional vice president in the Pacific Northwest. David will be working out of JND’s headquarters in Seattle, Washington. In his role, David is responsible for business development in all areas of eDiscovery, forensics, managed services, litigation readiness and analytics.
“As JND eDiscovery continues to expand, we are fortunate to have David on board to help manage new growth initiatives while supporting our client’s needs,” commented Neil Zola, executive co-chairman and co-founder at JND Legal Administration. “David understands the challenges that our clients face in their day-to-day legal matters and is well-equipped to help them find solutions with JND’s unique service offerings.”
An accomplished sales leader in the legal solutions and technology market, David brings more than 14 years of experience in partnering with law firms and companies to develop comprehensive eDiscovery solutions and offers specialized expertise in cases involving large data breach investigations. Prior to joining JND, David held leadership and sales positions at a number of companies providing technology solutions to the legal industry. Most recently, he served as vice president, business development at Advanced Discovery and as regional manager for Recommind.
Before his career in the legal services industry, David was a member of the United States Armed Forces, serving in the Navy during the Gulf War. David completed dispute resolution training at Pepperdine University School of Law.
About JND Legal Administration
JND Legal Administration is a legal management and administration company led by a team of industry veterans who are passionate about providing superior service to clients. Armed with decades of expertise and a powerful set of tools, JND has deep experience expertly navigating the intricacies of multiple, intersecting service lines including class action settlements, corporate restructuring, e-discovery, mass tort claims and government services. JND is trusted by law firms, government agencies and Fortune 500 companies across the nation. The company is backed by Stone Point Capital and has offices in California, Colorado, Minnesota, New York, Washington and Washington, D.C. For more information about JND, visit www.JNDLA.com .
